uniqueRequirements: Permit phase requires 50 hours of practice (10 at night)
Must be enrolled in an approved Driver Education course if under age 17 and 3 months
Dutch Reach method recommended for opening doors

questions.questionText: Scott's Law (The Move Over Law) requires drivers approaching a stationary emergency vehicle with flashing lights to:

answers.text: Slow down and, if safe, change lanes away from the emergency vehicle
Speed up to clear the area

questions.explanation: Scott's Law mandates that drivers slow down, proceed with caution, and change lanes (if safe) away from any stationary vehicle with flashing lights.

questions.questionText: In Illinois, the use of a cell phone while driving is prohibited for:

answers.text: All drivers, unless using a hands-free device or in an emergency

questions.explanation: Illinois law prohibits the use of handheld cell phones for all drivers. Only hands-free devices are permitted for drivers over 19.

questions.questionText: During the Initial Licensing Phase (ages 16-17), a driver may not drive between:
questions.explanation: Nighttime driving restrictions for teen drivers are 10 PM to 6 AM (Sun-Thu) and 11 PM to 6 AM (Fri-Sat).

questions.questionText: When opening your car door into traffic, Illinois law recommends using the 'Dutch Reach', which is:

answers.text: Using your far hand (the hand furthest from the door) to reach across and open the door

questions.explanation: The Dutch Reach involves using your far hand to open the door, forcing your body to turn so you can look for cyclists and oncoming traffic.

questions.questionText: Transporting cannabis in a vehicle is legal only if:

answers.text: It is in the glove box
It is in an odor-proof, child-resistant container that is sealed and inaccessible to the driver
It is in the passenger's lap
The driver has a medical card

questions.explanation: Cannabis must be in a sealed, odor-proof, child-resistant container and reasonably inaccessible while the vehicle is moving.

questions.questionText: Drivers under 21 convicted of a DUI will have their license revoked for a minimum of:
questions.explanation: A driver under 21 convicted of DUI faces a minimum 2-year license revocation.

questions.questionText: A red octagonal sign always means:
questions.explanation: The red octagon is exclusively used for STOP signs.

questions.questionText: A yellow pennant sign on the left side of the road indicates:
questions.explanation: The pennant sign marks the beginning of a No Passing Zone.

questions.questionText: When hydroplaning, you should:

answers.text: Ease off the gas and grip the wheel firmly

questions.explanation: Do not brake or accelerate. Ease off the gas and steer straight until traction returns.

questions.questionText: When a school bus is stopped on a two-lane road with its red lights flashing and stop arm extended:

answers.text: Only traffic behind the bus must stop

questions.explanation: On a two-lane road, traffic in both directions must stop for a school bus with flashing red lights and extended stop arm.

questions.questionText: You are required to yield to pedestrians:

answers.text: Only when they have a walk signal

questions.explanation: Drivers must yield to pedestrians in any marked or unmarked crosswalk.

questions.questionText: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit on rural areas/highways is:
questions.explanation: The statutory speed limit for rural areas is 55 mph unless posted otherwise.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a fire hydrant.
questions.explanation: Parking within 15 feet of a fire hydrant is prohibited.

questions.questionText: A 5-sided yellow sign shaped like a schoolhouse indicates:
questions.explanation: The pentagon shape is reserved for School Zones and School Crossings.

questions.questionText: If you run off the pavement:

answers.text: Grip the wheel firmly, ease off the gas, and brake gently

questions.explanation: Do not panic. Grip the wheel, slow down gradually, and steer back onto the road when safe.

questions.questionText: You may turn right on red:

answers.text: After coming to a complete stop and yielding to traffic/pedestrians, unless posted otherwise
Only if a green arrow is present

questions.explanation: Right on red is legal in Illinois after a full stop, unless a sign prohibits it.

questions.questionText: When passing another vehicle, you should not return to the right lane until:

answers.text: You can see the entire front of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror
You are going faster than the limit

questions.explanation: Wait until you can see the entire front of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror before returning to the lane.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in school zones, on school days between 7 a.m. and 4 p.m. when children are present, is:
questions.explanation: The school zone speed limit is 20 mph when children are present on school days.

questions.questionText: A yellow diamond-shaped sign with a cross (+) indicates:
questions.explanation: A cross sign (+) warns of an intersection ahead.

questions.questionText: If you are under 18 and are convicted of a traffic violation during the Initial Licensing Phase:

answers.text: Your restrictions are extended for 6 months

questions.explanation: A conviction during the Initial Licensing Phase extends the passenger and night restrictions for 6 months.

questions.questionText: When headlights are required, they must be dimmed ___ feet before meeting an oncoming vehicle.
questions.explanation: You must dim high beams 500 feet before meeting an oncoming vehicle.

questions.questionText: Aggravated speeding (Class A Misdemeanor) is driving ___ mph or more over the limit.
questions.explanation: Driving 35 mph or more over the limit is Aggravated Speeding (Class A Misdemeanor).

questions.questionText: A round yellow sign with an X and RR means:
questions.explanation: The round yellow sign is the advance warning for a railroad crossing.

questions.questionText: If a vehicle starts to skid on water (hydroplane), you should:

answers.text: Take your foot off the accelerator and let the vehicle slow down

questions.explanation: Ease off the gas. Do not brake or steer suddenly.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to pass on the shoulder of the road:

answers.text: Allowed if the car ahead is turning left

questions.explanation: Driving on the shoulder to pass another vehicle is illegal.

questions.questionText: When a funeral procession is passing:

answers.text: You must yield the right of way
You can cut through if there is a gap

questions.explanation: Motorists must yield to all vehicles in a funeral procession.

questions.questionText: For the first 12 months of licensing (or until age 18), the number of passengers is limited to:

answers.text: One person under age 20, unless immediate family

questions.explanation: Passengers are limited to one person under 20, unless they are siblings/children of the driver.

questions.questionText: Orange signs indicate:
questions.explanation: Orange is used for work zones. Slow down.

questions.questionText: A flashing red light means:

answers.text: Stop, yield, and proceed when safe

questions.explanation: A flashing red light is treated exactly like a stop sign.

questions.questionText: Following distance should be at least:
questions.explanation: Illinois recommends a following distance of 3-4 seconds.

questions.questionText: If you are involved in a crash causing damage to an unattended vehicle:

answers.text: Stop, find the owner or leave a note with your info, and notify police

questions.explanation: You must leave your contact info on the vehicle and notify the police.

questions.questionText: When making a left turn:

answers.text: You have the right of way
Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians

questions.explanation: Left turning vehicles must yield to oncoming traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with a red circle and a slash means:
questions.explanation: The red circle with a slash means the action is prohibited.

questions.questionText: Your license can be suspended for:

answers.text: Failing to yield to an emergency vehicle (Scott's Law)

questions.explanation: Illinois can suspend licenses for Scott's Law violations, unpaid parking tickets (10+), and child support delinquency.

questions.questionText: When entering a highway from an entrance ramp:

answers.text: Stop at the end of the ramp
Match speed with traffic and merge

questions.explanation: Use the acceleration lane to match the speed of highway traffic before merging.

questions.questionText: Unless posted otherwise, the speed limit in city/town areas is:
questions.explanation: The statutory speed limit in urban districts is 30 mph unless posted otherwise.

questions.questionText: You are required to signal before turning for at least:
questions.explanation: In a business or residential district, you must signal continuously for at least 100 feet before turning.

questions.questionText: When parking downhill with a curb, turn your wheels:
questions.explanation: Turn wheels toward the curb so if the car rolls, it hits the curb.

questions.questionText: The speed limit in an alley is:
questions.explanation: The speed limit in alleys is 15 mph.

questions.questionText: A child under the age of ___ must be secured in an appropriate child restraint system.
questions.explanation: The Child Passenger Protection Act requires children under age 8 to be secured in an appropriate child restraint system.

questions.questionText: Children must ride rear-facing until age:
questions.explanation: Illinois law requires children to ride rear-facing until age 2 unless they weigh more than 40 pounds or are taller than 40 inches.

questions.questionText: A green sign usually indicates:
questions.explanation: Green signs are guide signs that tell you where you are, which way to go and the distance.

questions.questionText: A blue sign usually indicates:
questions.explanation: Blue signs guide you to services like gas, food, lodging, and hospitals.

questions.questionText: A brown sign usually indicates:
questions.explanation: Brown signs point to parks, historic sites, and other points of interest.

questions.questionText: When a train is approaching, you must stop between ___ and ___ feet from the nearest rail.
questions.explanation: You must stop within 15 to 50 feet of the nearest rail when a train is approaching.

questions.questionText: Headlights must be used when visibility is less than:
questions.explanation: Headlights are required when visibility is less than 1,000 feet or weather conditions require wipers.

questions.questionText: A solid yellow line on your side of the center line means:
questions.explanation: A solid yellow line on your side means do not pass.

questions.questionText: When two vehicles arrive at a 4-way stop at the same time, the vehicle on the ___ has the right of way.
questions.explanation: At a 4-way stop, yield to the driver on the right if you arrive at the same time.

questions.questionText: You must not make a U-turn on curves or hills unless you can be seen for at least:
questions.explanation: U-turns are prohibited on curves/hills unless visible from 500 feet in both directions.

questions.questionText: The minimum fine for a first offense of speeding in a construction zone is:
questions.explanation: The minimum fine for a first offense of speeding in a work zone is $375.

questions.questionText: If you refuse to submit to a chemical test (Implied Consent), your license will be suspended for:
questions.explanation: Refusing a chemical test results in a 12-month (1 year) suspension for a first offense.

questions.questionText: A vertical rectangular sign typically indicates:
questions.explanation: Vertical rectangles are generally used for regulatory signs.

questions.questionText: A diamond-shaped sign indicates:
questions.explanation: Diamond shapes are used for warning signs.

questions.questionText: An inverted triangle sign means:
questions.explanation: The inverted triangle is exclusively used for Yield signs.

questions.questionText: In fog, you should use:
questions.explanation: Use low beam headlights in fog. High beams reflect off the moisture causing glare.

questions.questionText: If your front right wheel runs off the pavement, you should:

answers.text: Ease off the gas, steer straight, and gently brake

questions.explanation: Don't panic. Ease off the gas, grip the wheel, and gently steer back when safe.

questions.questionText: If you experience a tire blowout:

answers.text: Grip the steering wheel firmly and ease off the gas

questions.explanation: Keep the vehicle going straight, ease off the gas, and pull over when safe. Do not brake hard.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to flash your turn signals:

answers.text: On one side of a parked car
As a courtesy or 'do pass' signal

questions.explanation: Flashing turn signals as a courtesy to tell others to pass is illegal.

questions.questionText: A steady yellow traffic light means:

answers.text: The light will change to red soon; prepare to stop
Speed up to beat the red

questions.explanation: Yellow means the light is changing to red. Stop if you can do so safely.

questions.questionText: You may pass another vehicle on the right when:

answers.text: The road has two or more lanes in your direction

questions.explanation: Passing on the right is allowed on multi-lane roads or if the car ahead is turning left, but never off-pavement.

questions.questionText: When approaching a yield sign:

answers.text: Slow down and yield right-of-way to traffic/pedestrians
Ignore it if no cars are seen

questions.explanation: Yield means let others go first. Stop if necessary.

questions.questionText: Pedestrians walking on a highway without sidewalks must walk:
questions.explanation: Pedestrians must walk facing oncoming traffic for safety.

questions.questionText: Hitchhiking is:
questions.explanation: Standing on the roadway to solicit a ride (hitchhiking) is illegal in Illinois.

questions.questionText: Motorcyclists are entitled to:

answers.text: The full width of a lane

questions.explanation: Motorcycles have the same rights as cars, including full lane use.

questions.questionText: Bicyclists must follow:

answers.text: The same traffic laws as vehicles

questions.explanation: Bicyclists on the road have the same rights and responsibilities as vehicle drivers.

questions.questionText: Blind spots are:

answers.text: Areas around your car you cannot see in mirrors
Areas in front of your car

questions.explanation: Blind spots are areas to the side and rear not visible in mirrors.

questions.questionText: When entering a construction zone:

answers.text: Slow down and discontinue wireless phone use

questions.explanation: Slow down, obey signs, and avoid phone use in work zones.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a cross (+) means:
questions.explanation: A cross symbol on a yellow sign warns of an intersection ahead.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a traffic signal picture means:
questions.explanation: Warning sign for a traffic signal ahead.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Merge' and an arrow means:

answers.text: Traffic is merging from the side

questions.explanation: Warns of merging traffic.

questions.questionText: Driving without liability insurance results in:
questions.explanation: Driving uninsured leads to fines and suspension.

questions.questionText: The legal BAC limit for drivers 21 and over is:
questions.explanation: 0.08% is the legal limit for adults.

questions.questionText: If you are convicted of passing a stopped school bus, your license will be:
questions.explanation: First conviction for passing a school bus results in a 3-month suspension.

questions.questionText: When parking uphill with a curb, turn wheels:
questions.explanation: Away from curb so if it rolls, the tire hits the curb.

questions.questionText: You may not pass within ___ feet of an intersection or railroad crossing.
questions.explanation: Passing is prohibited within 100 feet of intersections/railroad crossings.

questions.questionText: Winter driving requires:

answers.text: Increased following distance and gentle braking

questions.explanation: Increase distance and avoid sudden moves on snow/ice.

questions.questionText: If your accelerator sticks:

answers.text: Hook your toe under it to free it

questions.explanation: Try to free it with your toe. If that fails, shift to neutral and brake.

questions.questionText: In Illinois, headlights must be dimmed ___ feet before passing another vehicle.
questions.explanation: Dim lights 300 feet when following (passing from behind).

questions.questionText: A flashing yellow traffic light means:
questions.explanation: Proceed with caution.

questions.questionText: A red circle with a slash means:
questions.explanation: Prohibits the action shown.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a deer means:
questions.explanation: Deer crossing warning.

questions.questionText: You are approaching a red light. A police officer directs you to go through. You should:
questions.explanation: Police orders overrule traffic signals.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to leave a child under age ___ alone in a vehicle.
questions.explanation: Child endangerment includes leaving a child under 6 unattended.

questions.questionText: When checking blind spots, you should:

answers.text: Turn your head and look over your shoulder

questions.explanation: Head check is required.

questions.questionText: You must yield to emergency vehicles:
questions.explanation: Yield to active emergency vehicles.

questions.questionText: To recover from a skid:
questions.explanation: Steer in the direction the rear is skidding.

questions.questionText: Passing is prohibited:

answers.text: On a hill or curve where view is obstructed

questions.explanation: Do not pass where visibility is limited.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a T-shape means:
questions.explanation: T-intersection warning.

questions.questionText: If a traffic light shows a red arrow:

answers.text: Do not turn in that direction

questions.explanation: Red arrow means stop and do not turn.

questions.questionText: If you must park on a highway (emergency):
questions.explanation: Move completely off the pavement if possible.

questions.questionText: When checking mirrors, check blind spots by:
questions.explanation: Head checks clear blind spots.

questions.questionText: You must stop for a school bus:

answers.text: When the stop arm is extended
Only if in the same lane

questions.explanation: Stop arm extended means stop.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a winding arrow means:
questions.explanation: Warning for winding road.

questions.questionText: Possession of a fraudulent license results in:
questions.explanation: Fake ID possession is serious; revocation and fines apply.

questions.questionText: When exiting an alley, you must:
questions.explanation: Stop before sidewalk to check for peds.

questions.questionText: You are approaching a green light but traffic blocks the intersection. You should:
questions.explanation: Do not block the intersection.

questions.questionText: Motorcycles have the same rights/duties as:
questions.explanation: Motorcycles are vehicles.

questions.questionText: If your brakes fail:

answers.text: Pump them and shift to lower gear

questions.explanation: Pump brakes to build pressure, use engine braking.

questions.questionText: A sign with a truck going down a hill means:
questions.explanation: Steep hill warning.

questions.questionText: Before changing lanes, you should:
questions.explanation: Verify clear path via mirrors and head check.

questions.questionText: Adults (21+) with BAC between 0.05% and 0.08%:

answers.text: May be convicted of DUI if impaired

questions.explanation: Between 0.05 and 0.08, other evidence can convict for DUI.

questions.questionText: When parking on a street with a curb:
questions.explanation: Wheels must be within 12 inches of curb.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a pedestrian symbol means:
questions.explanation: Warning for pedestrians.

questions.questionText: You must use your turn signal:
questions.explanation: Signal all lane changes and turns.

questions.questionText: The 3-second rule refers to:
questions.explanation: 3-4 seconds is the safe following distance.

questions.questionText: If you are convicted of 3 moving violations in 12 months (over 21):
questions.explanation: 3 moving violations in 12 months leads to suspension.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Do Not Pass' is:
questions.explanation: Do Not Pass is a regulatory white rectangle (Pennant warns of zone).

questions.questionText: When parking downhill without a curb:
questions.explanation: Turn right so car rolls off road.

questions.questionText: Fatigue affects driving by:
questions.explanation: Drowsiness impairs judgment and reaction.

questions.questionText: A flashing red light at a railroad crossing means:
questions.explanation: Stop. Do not cross until lights stop flashing.

questions.questionText: You may cross a double solid yellow line:
questions.explanation: Only to turn left into/out of alley/driveway.

questions.questionText: In a business district, signal ___ feet before turning.
questions.explanation: 100 feet in urban areas.

questions.questionText: If your front wheel slips off the pavement:
questions.explanation: Regain control before steering back.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'One Way' and arrow means:

answers.text: Traffic flows only in direction of arrow

questions.explanation: One way traffic direction.

questions.questionText: When checking blind spots, check:
questions.explanation: Look over shoulder to side and rear.

questions.questionText: Using a fake ID results in:
questions.explanation: Revocation for fraudulent ID.

questions.questionText: When turning left, yield to:
questions.explanation: Left turn must yield to oncoming.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a signal light symbol means:
questions.explanation: Signal ahead warning.

questions.questionText: If you drive into fog:

answers.text: Slow down and use low beams

questions.explanation: Low beams reduce glare in fog.

questions.questionText: Unless posted, highway speed limit is:
questions.explanation: 55 mph default for rural/highways.

questions.questionText: Merging traffic must:
questions.explanation: Merging cars yield to existing traffic.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Keep Right' means:
questions.explanation: Keep to the right of the divider.

questions.questionText: Using a cell phone while driving:
questions.explanation: Distracted driving is dangerous.

questions.questionText: You can turn right on red:
questions.explanation: Legal after stop unless posted.

questions.questionText: Motorcycles are entitled to:
questions.explanation: Full lane use for motorcycles.

questions.questionText: If you miss your exit:
questions.explanation: Never back up on highway.

questions.questionText: Flashing yellow arrow means:
questions.explanation: Yield to oncoming traffic then turn.

questions.questionText: A fluorescent pink sign means:
questions.explanation: Pink is for emergency incidents.

questions.questionText: When stopping for a school bus, you must remain stopped until:

answers.text: Stop arm retracts and bus moves

questions.explanation: Wait until bus signals cease and it moves.

questions.questionText: If a tire blows out:
questions.explanation: Maintain control, do not brake sharply.

questions.questionText: You must yield to funeral processions:
questions.explanation: Yield to procession vehicles.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Wrong Way' means:
questions.explanation: Do not enter; wrong direction.

questions.questionText: A driver under 21 with ANY trace of alcohol:
questions.explanation: Zero tolerance implies suspension.

questions.questionText: Use low beams in fog because:
questions.explanation: Reflection causes glare.

questions.questionText: You must yield right-of-way when:
questions.explanation: Left turn yields to oncoming.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a truck rollover symbol:
questions.explanation: Rollover risk warning.

questions.questionText: A solid white line on the right edge is:
questions.explanation: Marks the road edge.

questions.questionText: When following a truck, stay out of:
questions.explanation: Avoid blind spots.

questions.questionText: The speed limit on Illinois tollways is typically:
questions.explanation: 70 mph on many tollways/interstates.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'No Right Turn' symbol:
questions.explanation: Red slash means prohibited.

questions.questionText: It is illegal to park within ___ feet of a crosswalk at an intersection.
questions.explanation: 20 feet from crosswalk.

questions.questionText: In heavy rain, slow down to prevent:
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning happens on wet roads.

questions.questionText: If a traffic light is out (dark):
questions.explanation: Dark signal equals stop sign.

questions.questionText: A yellow sign with a farm machine symbol:
questions.explanation: Warning for slow farm vehicles.

questions.questionText: You must yield to:
questions.explanation: Pedestrians have right of way.

questions.questionText: When passing, return to lane when:
questions.explanation: Ensure safe distance before returning.

questions.questionText: Drivers must have:
questions.explanation: Liability insurance is mandatory.

questions.questionText: A sign with 'Reduced Speed Ahead':
questions.explanation: Speed limit lowers soon.

questions.questionText: Backing up on a shoulder/freeway:
questions.explanation: Never back up on freeway.

questions.questionText: If you are drowsy:
questions.explanation: Rest is the only cure.
